title: Ben Youngs warns England they must get on the front foot early: 'We need to make sure we get the start we want'
text:
Ben Youngs has urged England to “fight to the end” in their World Cup quarter-final against Australia on Saturday, following Eddie Jones’ description of the players as his Samurai warriors.

Youngs is only one of three players in the starting XV to have played in a World Cup quarter-final - during England’s 2011 World Cup campaign in New Zealand - along with Manu Tuilagi and Courtney Lawes, and insisted the players would not take a backward step in their bid to reach their first semi-final since 2007.

“It goes without saying that for everyone who is involved in the quarter-final, all this preparation, we have been in camp since June, you aren’t going to go out there and accept things not going...
description: Ben Youngs has urged England to “fight to the end” in their World Cup quarter-final against Australia on Saturday, following Eddie Jones’ description of the players as his Samurai warriors.
